title: Letters to Barron’s
text:
Income Approach

To the Editor:

Finding income ideas in this low-rate environment is no easy feat (“How to Play Upside-Down Interest Rates,” Cover Story, Oct. 11). However, before purchasing lower-quality investments or extending bond maturity beyond what is appropriate, prudent investors should be reminded of the potential consequences. These strategies can cause stock-like volatility in the fixed-income portion of one’s portfolio, which is generally viewed as more conservative. The last thing any investor wants is to experience...
description: Letters on income ideas, negative interest rates, Murphy’s Law, regional banks, and General Electric
